hero.subtitle: An Olympic Champion. An NBA Star. A Business Wizard.
hero.subtitleHighlight: Fresh ideas built on what works.

team.sectionSubtitle: Together, we bring Olympic legacy, global business acumen, and athlete advocacy experience.

core.sectionSubtitle: New leadership with the experience to deliver and the vision to go further.

built.title: We Know What Works
built.subtitle: The Modern WOA
built.description: We aligned on the key priorities ahead of the Lausanne EGA in 2024 and have a clear understanding of what NOAs value, what has worked well, and where improvements are needed. Our team is committed to protecting the progress already made while moving the organisation forward with a fresh and practical direction.

secure.title: We Secured It
secure.subtitle: Independent & Trusted
secure.description: Together, our team helped champion the protection of WOA's independence while rebuilding a productive working relationship with the IOC that delivers funding and influence.

lead.title: We're Listening
lead.subtitle: The Right Team
lead.description: An Olympic Champion, an NBA Star, and a Business Wizard—with complementary expertise: Pernilla brings Olympic governance and IOC experience, Lumi brings professional sport business insight, Thomas brings financial and technology acumen. The complete package, listening to your needs.

achievements.sectionLabel: Building on Progress, Preparing the Next Phase
achievements.quote: The WOA once had no grants, no scholarships, no NOA toolkits, no Development Officers. Today it does. Pernilla has been part of building this foundation. Our team will protect and expand these gains.

olyDesignation.title: OLY Designation
olyDesignation.description: Created the OLY post-nominal letters for all Olympians worldwide

worldForum.title: World Olympians Forum
worldForum.description: Established the global gathering of Olympians

serviceToSociety.title: Service to Society Grants
serviceToSociety.description: Funding for Olympians making community impact

iocFunding.title: IOC Funding Increase
iocFunding.description: Increased funding from IOC by up to 300%

devOfficers.title: Development Officers
devOfficers.description: Established regional development officers to support NOAs

devGrants.title: Development Grants
devGrants.description: Created development grants to help grow NOAs

olyHouseParis.title: OLY House Paris
olyHouseParis.description: Best OLY House ever at Paris 2024

fundraising.title: Fundraising Success
fundraising.description: Raised millions to fund OLY Houses and World Olympians Forums

healthResearch.title: Health Research
healthResearch.description: First-ever global musculoskeletal health survey of Olympians

olympiansForLife.title: Olympians for Life
olympiansForLife.description: Created the Olympians for Life awards and ceremonies

noaGuide.title: NOA Guide & Toolkits
noaGuide.description: Created comprehensive NOA Guide and Toolkits

relationships.title: Relationship Network
relationships.description: Built relationships with World Academy of Sport, SkillsBuild, and more

iocAgreement.title: New Agreement with IOC
iocAgreement.description: Secured independence, long-term funding and stability for all WOA programs

campaigns.title: Successful Global Campaigns
campaigns.description: When Ebola struck and our NOAs asked for help we launched #TargetEbola and thanks to the global Olympian community we sent six containers of medical and other supplies to Sierra Leone and Liberia. Our #OlympiansforUkraine campaign raised funding to help displaced Ukrainian Olympian families.

actionPlan.sectionSubtitle: We don't just have slogans. We have a concrete, funded, and actionable roadmap to modernize the WOA and empower National Olympians Associations.
actionPlan.whyMattersText: The WOA needs to evolve from a ceremonial body to a functional support network. Our plan focuses on financial decentralization and tangible tools for life after sport.

relations.title: Independent but Collaborative IOC Relations
relations.description: Maintaining our independence as an association while working closely and constructively with the IOC. We are the real bridge.

rights.title: Health, Pensions & Image Sovereignty
rights.description: We will aggressively champion a global safety net, lobbying for health insurance coverage and pension schemes for Olympians. Furthermore, we will demand the absolute protection of Image Rights post-Games. Once the competition ends, your likeness and your data belongs to you, and we will work to secure the frameworks that ensure you control your own legacy.

reform.title: Maintaining and Enhancing Gender Equity
reform.description: We commit to actively protect and enhance the historic 50/50 gender representation reform initiated by the WOA Constitution Committee chaired by Pernilla Wiberg.

transparency.title: Continuing Financial Transparency
transparency.description: The current administration moved from publishing our annual audit reports every four years to publishing them every year. We will continue that practice and ensure we implement the latest financial best practices and good governance processes. Going forward, WOA consolidated reports will be published on the WOA website.

empowerment.title: Building NOA Empowerment
empowerment.description: We will appoint a Development Officer for every continent and prioritise regional and continental workshops and meetings to build NOA capacity and experience.

digital.title: Supercharging OLY Connect
digital.description: We will leverage Thomas Tang's tech expertise to make OLY Connect the indispensable app for Olympians that provides them with benefits, opportunities, connections, and business, career and life networking and support.

legacy.title: Increasing NOA Grants
legacy.description: The NOA Development Grants and Service to Society and Service to Olympians Grants are always oversubscribed. We will raise more funding to increase the number of grants we can award every year.

endorsement.quote: For 14 years, we've worked tirelessly to create today's WOA which serves Olympians needs and empowers them to give back to their communities through our many services, initiatives and grants. Pernilla, Lumi, and Thomas have been integral to many of these achievements. They have my full confidence to continue this work and take the WOA to even greater heights. And, crucially, to protect our independence.
endorsement.author: Joël Bouzou
endorsement.title: WOA President (2011-2026)

contact.title: Work with us to take the WOA to the next level.
contact.subtitle: We want to hear from Olympians and National Olympians Associations. Request a meeting with Pernilla, Lumi, or Thomas to discuss the needs of your NOA and your Olympians.
contact.tagline: We built it. We secured it. We'll work with you to grow it.

form.messagePlaceholder: Any questions or information you'd like to share...
form.privacyLabel: I agree to the Privacy Policy and consent to having my data processed.

success.title: Request Sent!
success.message: We will be in touch shortly to schedule.

contact.error: Something went wrong. Please try again or contact us directly.

footer.description: We are a group of OLYs dedicated to serving the World Olympians Association with integrity, transparency, and action.
footer.copyright: 2026 Olympians United Campaign. All rights reserved.
footer.tagline: Built for the future of sport.

collection.title: Information We Collect
collection.content: We collect information you provide directly, including your name, email address, National Olympians Association, WhatsApp number, and any messages you submit through our contact form.

usage.title: How We Use Your Information
usage.content: We use your information to respond to your inquiries, schedule meetings with our candidates, and communicate about the Olympians United 2026 campaign. We do not sell or share your personal information with third parties for marketing purposes.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.content: Our website may embed content from third-party services such as YouTube and Vimeo for video content. These services may collect information about your visit. Please refer to their respective privacy policies for more information.

retention.title: Data Retention
retention.content: All personal data collected through this website will be permanently deleted at the end of January 2026, following the conclusion of the WOA election campaign.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.content: You have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal information. To exercise these rights, please contact us using the contact form on our website.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, please use the contact form on our website to reach us.

pernilla.name: Pernilla Wiberg, OLY
pernilla.keyAchievement: Double Olympic Champion with 20+ years of sports administration and athlete advocacy. Led the WOA constitutional reforms enabling 50/50 gender representation.
pernilla.philosophy: Make every-day life better for Olympians. Walk the talk.
pernilla.business: Entrepreneur, investor and business leader. CEO of Pernilla Wiberg Sportpromotion.
achievements: Winner of World Cup races in all 5 disciplines
governance: IOC Member (2002–2010): Athletes', Ethics, Nominations, Coordination Commissions
Chaired IOC Evaluation Commission for 1st Winter Youth Olympic Games (2008)
pernilla.bioFull:
Pernilla Wiberg is a legend on the slopes and a powerhouse in the boardroom. As a Triple Olympic Medalist with 24 individual World Cup victories, 61 World Cup podiums, and the 1997 Overall World Cup title, she is one of the few skiers in history to win races in all five alpine disciplines—her 1991 World Championship gold was the first for a Scandinavian woman in 33 years.

Beyond competition, she became a renowned TV sports commentator for Sveriges Television (SVT). In governance, she served as an IOC Member for eight years across multiple commissions, chaired the IOC Evaluation Commission for the first Winter Youth Olympic Games, and represented the WOA on the IOC Athletes' Commission from 2020–2025.

As current WOA Vice President, she was instrumental in the historic 50/50 continental gender representation reform of the WOA consitution. A Champions for Peace member and successful entrepreneur, she has business interested in hospitality, such as the Pernilla Wiberg Hotel in Sweden and is CEO of Pernilla Wiberg Sportpromotion. Based in Sweden and Monaco since 1995—strategically positioned near WOA Patron Prince Albert and the IOC in Lausanne. She is married to Bødvar Bjerke from Norway and has two children: Axel (born 2003) and Sofia (born 2007). Pernilla is fluent in Swedish, English, French, German, and Norwegian.
pernilla.manifesto:
As Olympians, we need the WOA. To connect, support, and empower us, and help us through our life transition, and particularly to advocate for our rights within the Olympic Movement.

We need a strong, independent WOA working hard to meet our needs, to help you grow your NOA, and your community projects.

WOA has done a lot the past 14 years. Gender equality in the continental groupings, creation of OLY and the NOA grants programs. Development Officers, University scholarships, "Target Ebola" and "Olympians for Ukraine" campaigns, the "World Olympians Forum" and the "Olympians Health Survey." None of that existed before.

The Olympic Games generate lots of money, is it correctly divided? Do Olympians have access to a pension system? Do we have access to a health system or an insurance throughout our lives? Do we have full access to the footage of our performance at the Games?

But I would like to hear from you in a more structured way. My first task, if elected, will be to undertake a full 360 review of our processes, our priorities, and a survey of your wishes and needs.

Together we can make a real impact, by not being afraid of change or tackling the difficult subjects, by listening to each other and working together.

As Olympians we have a power. Let us use it. I am ready to take on the challenge, are you?

lumi.name: Olumide Oyedeji, OLY
lumi.keyAchievement: NBA star turned athlete advocate. Transformed Nigeria Olympians Association and founded youth development initiatives, independently and with partners, reaching over 45,000 young people across 30+ cities in 20+ countries.
lumi.philosophy: Athlete-First Leadership. Understanding the billion-dollar business of professional sport to better protect athlete welfare, retirement, and image rights.
lumi.business: Chairman & CEO: Legendary Venture and Lume Global Consultancy (200+ employees, including 6 Olympians and 20+ former athletes). Founder & President: Olumide Oyedeji Youth Foundation (2000–Present). President & CEO: Hoops & Read Basketball Club (Nigeria Premier League). President: Dolphins Basketball Club of Lagos.
achievements: First African player drafted outside America to the NBA (2000)
NBA Player (Seattle SuperSonics, Orlando Magic, Atlanta Hawks)
Led Nigeria to first-ever Gold Medal in Basketball at 2011 All Africa Games
Led Nigeria to first-ever AfroBasket Gold (2015) & first Olympic appearance (2012)
Only African to compete in ALL major tournaments: Olympics, World Cup, NBA, EuroLeague, Commonwealth Games, All Africa Games
MVP awards in German, Korean, Chinese & Nigerian leagues
Played professionally in 18 countries across 4 continents over 2 decades
governance: Chairman: World Olympians Association Job Committee
Former Executive Member: FIBA Players' Commission
Vice Chairman: FIBA Zone 3 Development Council
President: Sports For All Commission NOC
lumi.bioFull:
Olumide "Lumi" Oyedeji is one of the most decorated basketball players in African history and a true Renaissance man. Not only a legendary professional athlete, but also a Career and Motivational Speaker, Sports Administrator, Guidance & Counselor expert, Performance Management specialist, Leadership & Management professional, Psychologist, and well-renowned Philanthropist.

The first African player ever drafted outside America to the NBA (2000), he made history as the only African to compete in ALL major basketball tournaments worldwide—Olympics, World Cup, NBA, EuroLeague, Commonwealth Games, and All Africa Games. His remarkable career spanned over two decades (1996–2016), playing professionally in 18 countries across 4 continents with different cultural backgrounds, giving him a unique understanding of the needs of Olympians on every continent.

As Team Nigeria Captain from 2006–2016, he led Nigeria to their first-ever Gold Medal in Basketball at the 2011 All Africa Games in Mozambique, their first-ever AfroBasket Gold in Tunisia 2015, and their first Olympic appearance at London 2012. His international career includes 9 FIBA Africa Championships, 5 All Africa Games (Gold 2011, Silver 2003, Bronze 1999/2007/2015), and championships in Spain, Italy, Greece, UK, Russia, Germany, Japan, South Korea, China, Jordan, Slovenia, Kuwait, and Puerto Rico. He earned MVP honours in the German, Korean, Chinese, and Nigerian leagues.

Beyond sport, he is Chairman & CEO of Legendary Venture and Lume Global Consultancy, employing over 200 people including 6 Olympians and 20+ former athletes. Now based in Lagos, he serves as Vice President of the Nigeria Olympic Committee, President of the Nigeria Olympians Association, Chairman of the WOA Job Committee, and President of West Africa Basketball.

As President of the Nigeria Olympians Association, he transformed the organization through comprehensive rebranding, secured insurance benefits for Olympians, established the Olympians Village and recreation center with hectares of land, achieved NOA inclusion as a full Executive Committee member of the Nigeria Olympic Committee, and established the Olympians Trust Fund. His leadership philosophy centers on rewarding, supporting, and celebrating Olympians while promoting their inclusion in decision making.

A BAL Ambassador, NBA Africa Ambassador, and Laureus Global Ambassador, his foundation has mentored over 45,000 young people across 30+ cities in 20+ countries since 2000. Through Hoops & Read Basketball Club, he has produced 2 NBA players, 45 college players, and 20+ professionals in Europe, Asia, and South America.
lumi.manifesto:
I am honored to offer myself as a candidate for Secretary General of the World Olympians Association, guided by gratitude, humility, and a strong sense of purpose. At the London 2012 Olympic Games, I experienced what it truly means to be an Olympian: belonging to a global family that lifts each of us higher than we could ever rise alone. That moment continues to shape my commitment to serve.

Competing and working across six continents has shown me that while cultures and circumstances differ, the Olympic spirit unites us. I have listened to NOAs with strong structures and resources, and to others struggling simply to remain active. I have spoken with Olympians eager to mentor youth, support their communities, protect their wellbeing, and build meaningful lives after sport, but who often need clearer pathways and practical support. These voices guide my desire to serve every Olympian and every NOA.

Our focus must now be on delivery. We will hire additional Development Officers to strengthen continental and regional support. We will raise more funding to expand NOA grant programmes so more associations can deliver real impact. We will convene Continental Olympians Forums every year to share knowledge, strengthen networks, and build leadership. We will also advocate for stronger post-Games support for Olympians, including access to health insurance and long-term protection of their rights.

If entrusted with this responsibility, I will serve with empathy, integrity, and commitment, helping to build a future worthy of the legacy we carry together.

thomas.name: Thomas Tang, OLY
thomas.location: Taipei, with residences in Park City (Utah), Portland (Oregon), Hong Kong & Guinea-Bissau
thomas.keyAchievement: Business and Technology Wizard. Built a global tech company from scratch powering Olympic Games and FIFA World Cup broadcasts worldwide. Active in winter sports development.
thomas.business: Founder & President: Apantac LLC (Global leader in broadcast & ProAV, HQ in Beaverton, Oregon with offices in Paris, Taipei, Tokyo, Singapore & Mexico City). President: Eubank Investment Group.
thomas.trackRecord: Founded Apantac in his basement in 2008. Won prestigious PICK HIT AWARD at NAB 2009 and multiple "Best of Show" awards. By 2014: 200+ products distributed in 40+ countries. Technology powers Olympic Games broadcasts, Soccer World Cups, and national broadcasters worldwide. Prior experience: VP at Avitech International (grew business 8x), Director of Marketing at Philips Electronics Broadcast Division ($50M P&L responsibility), Asia Pacific Area Director at Vizrt, worked on F-14/F-16 flight simulators and NASA Space Shuttle training systems at Evans & Sutherland. Holds 6 patents and published works in laser spectroscopy, virtual production, and AV technology.
governance: Secretary General: Guinea-Bissau Winter Sports Federation (2023–Present)
Board Member: Taiwanese American Chamber of Commerce (2023–Present)
Director of International Affairs: Chinese Taipei Olympians Association
education: Harvard Business School - Executive Education (Marketing & Business Strategy)
University of Utah - M.S., Applied Physics
thomas.manifesto:
As part of a strong leadership team alongside Pernilla Wiberg and Olumide Oyedeji, I am running for Treasurer of the World Olympians Association with a clear mission to safeguard WOA's financial integrity, strengthen its long-term sustainability, and ensure Olympians benefit from transparent, accountable, and impactful resource management.

[My professional background](https://app.box.com/s/5xdpz83s6jj72m7z4ozbp4ts601bsj2a) spans more than 30 years of executive leadership across international business, technology, and nonprofit development. I have managed multimillion-dollar budgets, built successful global organizations, and implemented robust financial systems grounded in responsibility and trust. I will bring these same principles to serve the WOA.

I will prioritize financial transparency and accountability through clear reporting standards, continued independent audits, and open communication so every NOA can clearly understand how WOA resources are utilized. I will also focus on securing sustainable funding and building long-term partnerships that honor Olympic values while ensuring WOA remains financially strong and independent. Collaboration with the IOC is essential for alignment and shared purpose, yet WOA must always preserve its autonomy and its ability to advocate for Olympians with clarity and neutrality.

My commitment extends to service at the community level, where the heart of the Olympian movement truly lives. I will work to ensure more resources reach grassroots initiatives, supporting education, health, career transition, and youth programs, while giving special attention to smaller NOAs and developing nations to ensure equitable access and meaningful impact.

As Treasurer, I will serve with integrity, discipline, and unwavering dedication, strengthening the WOA and empowering Olympians for generations to come.
thomas.bioFull:
Thomas Tang combines Olympic grit with Silicon Valley innovation. A two-time Winter Olympian for Chinese Taipei who competed at World Championships and World Cups, he now serves as Chef de Mission for Guinea-Bissau at the 2026 Milano-Cortina Olympics and Secretary General of their Winter Sports Federation—driving the introduction of winter sports in a tropical nation, securing FIS membership, and establishing athlete development programs. His Olympic legacy is a family affair—his daughter competed at Figure Skating at an international level, and his sons have qualified for the 2022 and 2026 Olympics in Alpine Skiing.

Thomas founded Apantac in his basement during the 2008 financial crisis and built it into a global broadcast, ProAV, and openGear technology leader—winning multiple "Best of Show" awards including the prestigious NAB PICK HIT AWARD in 2009, and now shipping 200+ products to 40+ countries, from Greenland to New Zealand. His technology has powered Olympic broadcasts, Soccer World Cups, major professional sports leagues, and national broadcasters worldwide, and is used daily by leading social media for their event spaces.

His 30+ year career spans executive leadership across international business, technology, and nonprofit development. Prior to founding Apantac, he served as Vice President at Avitech International (2004–2008) leading global sales and product expansion in broadcast and multiviewer technologies, Director of Marketing at Philips Electronics Broadcast Division (1999–2004) directing strategy across North America and Asia-Pacific with $50M P&L responsibility, Asia Pacific Area Director at Vizrt (1997–1999) expanding market presence for broadcast graphics and real-time visualization systems, and Regional Sales Manager at Evans & Sutherland (1989–1997) where he started as a Senior Software Engineer working on F-14/F-16 flight simulators and NASA Space Shuttle training systems before advancing to regional sales.

Thomas holds patents and published works including Laser Spectroscopy (SPIE, 1987), Physical Camera Calibration with Virtual Backgrounds (1996), Dynamic Shadows in Virtual Studio Production (1997), Cascading Multiviewer Outputs via SATA (2009), Mechanical Magnetic Mounting for AV Equipment (2014), and Intelligent EDID-Based DA Output Management (2018).

He also serves as Board Member of the Taiwanese American Chamber of Commerce (2023–Present), supporting cross-Pacific business collaboration and Taiwanese entrepreneurship in North America, and as President of Eubank Investment Group (2012–Present) and Anextus Trading & Export in Guinea-Bissau (2024–Present).

With Harvard Business School executive education in Marketing & Business Strategy, an M.S. in Computer Science from Westminster College, and both an M.S. in Applied Physics and B.S. in Physics from the University of Utah, Thomas brings unmatched financial acumen and operational excellence to the WOA. Fluent in English, Mandarin, Cantonese, and Taiwanese.
